laboratory_reports.description: Complete Blood Count with normal results
laboratory_reports.clinical_text: Patient presents for routine follow-up. Lab results from 01/15/2024: CBC shows WBC 7.5 K/uL (normal 4.5-11.0), RBC 4.8 M/uL (normal 4.2-5.4), Hemoglobin 14.2 g/dL (normal 12.0-16.0), Hematocrit 42.5% (normal 37-48%), Platelets 250 K/uL (normal 150-400). All values within normal limits. No evidence of anemia or infection.

expected_extraction.conclusion: All values within normal limits. No evidence of anemia or infection.

laboratory_reports.description: Comprehensive Metabolic Panel with abnormal glucose
laboratory_reports.clinical_text: Comprehensive metabolic panel completed this morning. Results: Glucose 185 mg/dL (HIGH, normal 70-100), BUN 22 mg/dL (normal 7-25), Creatinine 0.9 mg/dL (normal 0.6-1.2), Sodium 140 mEq/L, Potassium 4.1 mEq/L, Chloride 102 mEq/L, CO2 24 mEq/L. Interpretation: Elevated glucose consistent with diabetes. Kidney function normal. Electrolytes balanced.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Elevated glucose consistent with diabetes. Kidney function normal. Electrolytes balanced.

laboratory_reports.clinical_text: Fasting lipid panel results available. Total Cholesterol 245 mg/dL (HIGH, desirable <200), LDL Cholesterol 165 mg/dL (HIGH, optimal <100), HDL Cholesterol 38 mg/dL (LOW, normal >40), Triglycerides 210 mg/dL (HIGH, normal <150). Conclusion: Hyperlipidemia requiring statin therapy. Recommend lifestyle modifications and medication initiation.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Hyperlipidemia requiring statin therapy. Recommend lifestyle modifications and medication initiation.

laboratory_reports.clinical_text: Thyroid panel ordered for fatigue evaluation. TSH 8.5 mIU/L (HIGH, normal 0.4-4.0), Free T4 0.7 ng/dL (LOW, normal 0.9-1.7), Free T3 2.1 pg/mL (normal 2.0-4.4). Findings consistent with primary hypothyroidism. Recommend thyroid hormone replacement therapy.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Findings consistent with primary hypothyroidism

laboratory_reports.clinical_text: Urinalysis complete. Color: yellow, Clarity: cloudy, Specific gravity: 1.025, pH: 7.5, Protein: negative, Glucose: negative, Ketones: negative, Blood: trace, Nitrite: POSITIVE, Leukocyte esterase: POSITIVE, WBC: 25-50/hpf, RBC: 2-5/hpf, Bacteria: many. Impression: Findings consistent with urinary tract infection.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Findings consistent with urinary tract infection

laboratory_reports.clinical_text: Blood culture results finalized. Growth detected in 2 of 2 bottles. Organism identified: Escherichia coli. Antibiotic sensitivities: Sensitive to Ciprofloxacin, Ceftriaxone, Gentamicin. Resistant to Ampicillin. Recommend targeted antibiotic therapy based on sensitivities.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Growth detected. Escherichia coli identified.

laboratory_reports.clinical_text: Preliminary lab results available, pending final confirmation. Initial CBC shows possible leukocytosis with WBC 15.2 K/uL. Full differential pending. Will update when final results available.

expected_extraction.conclusion: possible leukocytosis

radiology_reports.clinical_text: Chest X-ray PA and lateral views performed 01/15/2024. Lungs are clear bilaterally without focal consolidation, pleural effusion, or pneumothorax. Cardiac silhouette is normal in size. Mediastinal contours are unremarkable. Osseous structures intact. Impression: No acute cardiopulmonary abnormality.

expected_extraction.conclusion: No acute cardiopulmonary abnormality

radiology_reports.clinical_text: CT abdomen and pelvis with IV contrast performed for acute abdominal pain. Findings: Dilated fluid-filled appendix measuring 12mm with periappendiceal fat stranding and fluid. No abscess formation. Small amount of free fluid in pelvis. Impression: Acute uncomplicated appendicitis. Recommend surgical consultation.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Acute uncomplicated appendicitis. Recommend surgical consultation.

radiology_reports.clinical_text: MRI brain with and without gadolinium performed for headaches. Technique: Multiplanar multisequence imaging including T1, T2, FLAIR, DWI sequences. Findings: No acute intracranial abnormality. No mass, midline shift, or abnormal enhancement. Ventricles and sulci appropriate for age. White matter signal normal. Impression: Normal MRI brain.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Normal MRI brain

radiology_reports.clinical_text: Abdominal ultrasound performed for RUQ pain. Liver: Normal size and echogenicity, no focal lesions. Gallbladder: Multiple mobile echogenic foci with posterior shadowing consistent with cholelithiasis. No gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid. CBD measures 4mm. Impression: Cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis

radiology_reports.clinical_text: Bilateral screening mammogram performed. Breast composition: Heterogeneously dense breast tissue. Findings: No suspicious masses, architectural distortion, or microcalcifications identified. BI-RADS Assessment: Category 1 - Negative. Recommendation: Routine screening mammogram in 1 year.

expected_extraction.conclusion: BI-RADS Category 1 - Negative

pathology_reports.clinical_text: Skin biopsy left shoulder received. Gross: 0.8 x 0.6 cm tan-brown lesion. Microscopic: Sections show benign compound melanocytic nevus with maturation. No atypia or mitotic activity identified. Margins clear. Diagnosis: Benign compound melanocytic nevus, completely excised.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Benign compound melanocytic nevus, completely excised

pathology_reports.clinical_text: Colonoscopy with polypectomy specimen. Site: Sigmoid colon, 25cm. Size: 8mm pedunculated polyp. Microscopic examination reveals tubular adenoma with low-grade dysplasia. No high-grade dysplasia or invasive carcinoma. Margins clear. Diagnosis: Tubular adenoma with low-grade dysplasia, completely removed. Recommend surveillance colonoscopy in 3-5 years.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Tubular adenoma with low-grade dysplasia, completely removed

pathology_reports.clinical_text: Image-guided core biopsy right breast 2:00 position. Microscopic: Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS), intermediate grade, cribriform and solid patterns. ER positive (95%), PR positive (80%), HER2 negative. No invasive carcinoma identified in this sample. Recommend surgical excision for complete assessment.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS), intermediate grade

pathology_reports.clinical_text: Frozen section consultation requested intraoperatively. Specimen: Right ovarian mass. Frozen section diagnosis: Benign serous cystadenoma. No evidence of malignancy on frozen section. Final permanent sections pending.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Benign serous cystadenoma

cardiology_reports.clinical_text: 12-lead ECG performed 01/15/2024 14:30. Rate: 72 bpm, Rhythm: Normal sinus rhythm, PR interval: 160 ms, QRS duration: 90 ms, QT/QTc: 380/410 ms, Axis: Normal. No ST-T wave abnormalities. No evidence of chamber enlargement. Interpretation: Normal ECG.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Normal ECG

cardiology_reports.clinical_text: ECG shows irregularly irregular rhythm with absent P waves, ventricular rate 110-130 bpm. QRS complexes narrow. No acute ST-T changes. Interpretation: Atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular response. Recommend rate control and anticoagulation assessment.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular response

cardiology_reports.clinical_text: Transthoracic echocardiogram performed. LV ejection fraction 55-60% (normal). Normal LV wall thickness and wall motion. LA mildly dilated. Normal RV size and function. Mild mitral regurgitation. Trivial tricuspid regurgitation. No pericardial effusion. Conclusion: Normal left ventricular systolic function. Mild mitral regurgitation.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Normal left ventricular systolic function. Mild mitral regurgitation.

cardiology_reports.clinical_text: Exercise stress test performed using Bruce protocol. Patient exercised for 9 minutes achieving 85% maximum predicted heart rate. No chest pain or significant arrhythmias during test. Blood pressure response appropriate. No significant ST segment changes. Test terminated due to fatigue. Interpretation: Negative for exercise-induced ischemia at achieved workload.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Negative for exercise-induced ischemia

cardiology_reports.clinical_text: 24-hour Holter monitor report. Total beats: 98,542. Predominant rhythm: Sinus. Average HR: 68 bpm (range 48-125). Rare isolated PVCs (<1%). No significant pauses or AV block. No sustained arrhythmias. Patient diary: Palpitations at 15:30 corresponded with sinus tachycardia during exercise. Conclusion: Sinus rhythm with rare PVCs. Symptoms correlate with appropriate sinus tachycardia.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Sinus rhythm with rare PVCs

complex_scenarios.clinical_text: Patient admitted with chest pain and fever. Workup completed: 1) ECG shows sinus tachycardia at 105 bpm, no ST changes. 2) Chest X-ray reveals right lower lobe infiltrate consistent with pneumonia. 3) CBC shows WBC 14.5 with left shift, Hemoglobin 13.2. 4) Blood cultures pending. 5) Troponin negative x2. Impression: Community-acquired pneumonia with no cardiac involvement.

AMENDED REPORT (original issued 01/14/2024): CT chest previously reported as normal. Upon further review, small 4mm nodule identified in right upper lobe. Recommend follow-up CT in 6 months for stability assessment. All other findings unchanged.

expected_extraction.conclusion: small 4mm nodule identified in right upper lobe

complex_scenarios.clinical_text: CRITICAL VALUE: Potassium 6.8 mEq/L (CRITICAL HIGH, normal 3.5-5.0). Provider notified at 14:35 by lab. Other electrolytes: Sodium 138, Chloride 106, CO2 22. Creatinine 3.2 mg/dL (elevated). Findings consistent with acute kidney injury with dangerous hyperkalemia. Urgent treatment required.

expected_extraction.conclusion: acute kidney injury with dangerous hyperkalemia

complex_scenarios.clinical_text: Chest X-ray compared to prior from 12/01/2023. Previously noted right pleural effusion has significantly improved, now trace. Left lung remains clear. Heart size stable and normal. No new acute findings. Impression: Interval improvement in right pleural effusion, now trace. Otherwise stable.

expected_extraction.conclusion: Interval improvement in right pleural effusion

complex_scenarios.description: Complex lab panel with mixed results
complex_scenarios.clinical_text: Admission labs completed. CBC: WBC 11.2 (mild elevation), Hgb 9.8 g/dL (LOW), Platelets 425K (mild elevation). Chemistry: Glucose 210 mg/dL (HIGH), BUN/Cr 45/1.8 (elevated), Na 134 (low), K 4.2. Liver panel: AST 85 (elevated), ALT 92 (elevated), Alk Phos normal, Bilirubin 2.1 (elevated). PT/INR: 14.5/1.3 (mildly elevated). Overall picture suggests mild anemia, hyperglycemia, mild renal insufficiency, and hepatocellular pattern liver injury.

expected_extraction.conclusion: mild anemia, hyperglycemia, mild renal insufficiency, and hepatocellular pattern liver injury

edge_cases.clinical_text: Urinalysis shows numerous white cells and bacteria consistent with infection.
CT abdomen ordered for abdominal pain. Results pending, will update when available.
MRI brain cancelled due to patient claustrophobia. Will proceed with CT instead.
